alert.note: Alert for Phelps; Pulaski (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 08 at 5:21PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Pulaski and west central Phelps Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 521 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Dixon, or 9 miles northeast of Waynesville, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Northern Fort Leonard Wood... Waynesville... St. Robert... Dixon... Crocker... Laquey... Devil`s Elbow... Swedeborg... Jerome... This includes Interstate 44 between mile markers 151 and 169, and between mile markers 171 and 175. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
